mdRecord.dcterms:title: Photograph of Stuart Memorial Drive
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: United States. Forest Service
mdRecord.dcterms:description: A section of Stuart Memorial Drive, which was named for Robert Y. Stuart. Stuart Memorial Drive is a scenic 10.3-mile road that adjoins the south side of the Otter Creek Wilderness. The road climbs from the Shaver's Fork River valley to near the top of Bickle Knob and Stuart Knob, which are two of the highest peaks in the local area.
